title: Pear Valley 2014 Pear Valley Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Smoked meat, dried mint and roasted black plums combine for a complex sense of elegance on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are cohesive yet varied, with black currant, violet and roasted beef, upheld by tannins that are soft yet steady, with a growing presence toward the finish.

title: Raymond 2014 LVE Legend Vineyard Exclusive Red (Napa Valley)
description: This John Legend-led partnership is a blend of 55% Petite Sirah, 39% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Petit Verdot. Bright, focused red cherry and cassis meets soft rounded tannin that contributes to a seamless offering of velvety texture.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Sicilia Vineyard Fiano (Sutter County)
description: This is a great change-of-pace wine, rather full in body and rich in texture, but with zesty grapefruit and rose petal aromas and buttery almond-like flavors that are more savory than simply fruity. As if Italian native Fiano wasn't a rare enough grape variety, the winemaker blended in 15% of Coda di Volpe, an even lesser known Italian variety.

title: Schwarzböck 2016 Ried Sätzen Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Weinviertel)
description: This wine's fresh, bright and zesty lime and green pear scents have a lovely touch of nettle. The palate has the sprightly ease of these fresh flavors but also a lovely, grounding element of yeast that adds texture.

title: Sierra Starr 2015 Super Nova Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is nicely balanced considering how big it is in terms of tannin and body. The aromas ooze blueberry syrup and blackberry jam while the flavors are equally rich. The texture is quite firm and tannic but it feels right and will help the wine age well. Best after 2022.

title: Sobon Estate 2016 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: A touch of smoky, spicy oak flavor gives this ripe and berry-soaked wine a nice twist of complexity. It has strawberry and boysenberry aromas, and full, almost jammy, flavors riding on a smooth texture that shows soft tannins.

title: Spy Valley 2015 Envoy Johnson Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Lifted aromas of lemon and grapefruit combine with toasted nuts, green flower stems and a salty, sea spray quality. The acidity in this wine at the moment is searing and texturally it's a little lean and mean, but this fumé-style Sauvignon should be an interesting one to watch develop in bottle over the next few years.

title: Substance 2014 Cs Vineyard Collection Jack's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Coming from a site in the Rocks District, this wine is lighter in color and brings initially subdued aromas of cassis, herb, medicine cabinet, plum, cherry and spice. The palate is soft in feel, putting a premium on elegance of expression, with the tannins quite supple. It's a very pretty expression of the variety.

title: Substance 2014 Cs Vineyard Collection Stoneridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Listed at a low alcohol level for a hot vintage and vineyard, this is still and 100% varietal. Its black licorice, sugared plum and exotic spice aromas show a penetrating purity. The palate is all about delicacy and elegance, which it brings in abundance. It's a very pretty expression of this variety, maybe too much so for some tastes, without the variety's typical tannic heft. But for those looking for a sophisticated style of Cabernet, look no further.

title: Terra di Seta 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this offers aromas of cooking spice, leather and a whiff of violet. The firm palate delivers ripe black cherry, clove and licorice set against closed-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Trentadue 2014 La Storia Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Black olive, truffle and a nuanced streak of graphite shine in this softly textured, focused and well-made wine. Cedar and dried herb complement quietly in the background, as integrated oak supports without distraction.

title: Valdivieso 2013 Caballo Loco Grand Cru Red (Maipo Valley)
description: To the eye, this Cabernet Sauvignon-led blend is light, with some rustiness. An earthy nose is funky and reduced at first, then more clear. A reduced palate with gritty tannins shows flavors of cooked berries, raisin and fig. Those same very ripe flavors persist on a warm finish.

title: XYZin 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)
description: Nice depth and breadth come together in this richly packed, fruity and full-bodied wine. There's a hint of freshly baked bread in the aroma along with ripe plum and blackberry, while an almost jammy richness spreads across the palate and lingers on the finish.

title: Zantho 2015 Reserve Zweigelt (Burgenland)
description: A flinty note of reduction hovers above the ripe, fleshy aromas of red and black cherries. The palate drives home the ripe and abundant cherry fruit on a concentrated, ripe but still fresh palate. The finish has ample fruit but also levity.

title: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Zoto Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very light in the glass, this twist-top bottling offers tight and bright aromas of white rose petals, citrus peel and cold steel on the nose. The palate is much more exciting, with lime zest, baked nectarine, lemongrass and a hint of marshmallow, all set against a chalky structure.

title: Casa Emma 2013 Vignalaparco  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of French oak, exotic spice and black-skinned berry take center stage. Fresh and linear, the palate offers cassis, cranberry and crushed raspberry framed in fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink through 2023.

title: Château du Trignon 2016 Roussanne (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Swirls of orange blossom and vanilla introduce this richly textured Roussanne. Soft, honeyed flavors of tangerine and pear are broad and expansive on the palate, accented by hints of earth and sunny lemon acidity. Drink now through 2021.

title: Brander 2016 Colson Canyon Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is a very young but already fully enjoyable twist-top bottling from a unique site in the rugged mountains north of the Santa Maria Valley. Fresh aromas of blackberry and black currant meet with rosemary and tarragon on the nose while the easy-to-quaff palate shows flavors of freshly plucked boysenberries, oregano and marjoram. The high alcohol is completely hidden.

title: Concha y Toro 2015 Marques de Casa Concha Carmenère (Peumo)
description: Leathery berry aromas are dense and earthy, while not showing any of the green character that sometimes plagues Carmenère. A flush mouthfeel is solid and fruity, with berry and plum flavors that are roasted and meaty. Savory notes on the finish suggest a pairing with barbecue.

title: Discovery Point 2014 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: A bright bouquet of red currants, strawberries, back pepper, olives and medicinal bitters show this Pinot to be approachable when young, particularly by Martinborough standards. The palate is silky, savory, earthy and red-fruited, finishing salty yet refreshing.

title: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Côte de Brouilly)
description: This ripe, soft wine is rich with red-cherry fruit and a generous texture from old vines. Spice, fruitiness and a hint of tannins contribute to a wine that is delicious and rounded, ready to drink now.

title: Domaine de Bel-Air 2016 Les Burdelines  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: A perfumed wine, this is rich in tannins and generous, ripe black fruits. Aged nine months in wood, it has a hint of caramel as well as spice that adds extra dimension. It is juicy, ripe and needs to age further. Drink from late 2018.

title: Domaine de la Bouronière 2016  Fleurie
description: Densely tannic, this rich wine is dark and structured. The black fruits have great weight and a generous nature. The acidity, typical of the vintage, indicates the wine needs to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine de la Combe au Loup 2016  Morgon
description: The granite soil of Morgon is very much in evidence in this firm, mineral-textured wine. With dark tannins and the potential of rich fruit, the wine is structured and needs time to mature further. Drink from 2019.
winery: Domaine de la Combe au Loup

title: Domaine de Roche Guillon 2016  Fleurie
description: This ripe, succulent wine, from the producer's home vineyard, is softly textured and richly fruity. Dense texture gives it a full-bodied feel as well a dry edge. This wine needs to age further. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Domaine de Verquiere 2015 Red (Rasteau)
description: The richness of Grenache is offset elegantly with Syrah's edgy, peppery finesse in this elegant blend. Black cherry and strawberry preserves are plump and ripe but balanced neatly with zesty acidity and bristling undertones of savory herb and chalky tannins.

title: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2015 Grand-Pré  (Fleurie)
description: Rich and benefitting from the ripe fruit of the vintage, this is a generous wine. Bold red and black cherry fruits are broad and open with soft tannins and good acidity. The wine is smooth and ready to drink.

title: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2016 Pisse Vieille  (Brouilly)
description: This wine is ripe, soft and generous. With red fruits and only light tannins it is cushioned and rounded. Happily the acidity and the crisp texture counter the richness. Drink this friendly wine now.

title: Ehlers Estate 2015 Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)
description: A 100% varietal wine from the producer's own vineyards, this is a full-bodied take on the variety that drinks crisp and clean, shining in extracted red and black cherry that become succulent in the glass. Broadly expansive tannins support rather than distract.

title: Eric Kent 2014 Atoosa's Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a meaty, brawny wine that's well-conceived and velvety smooth in texture. It ticks all the boxes on the variety, imparting well-defined layers of leather, black pepper, blackberry and gunpowder, lasting long on the finish in a trickle of spice.
